titleStmt.title: W. W. Trimble to James F. Robinson
CWG1506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
Cynthiana May 30th 1863.
J F Robinson Esq
Respd sir
Herewith I send the petition of the County Judge to gether with a copy of the indictment against James Kellar for murdering Jno Dills of this Co.

Kellar is about 23 years of age, tall and slender, hight about 6 feet one or two inches, light hair, fair complxion & blue Eyes. He generally wears weares a pair of black false whiskers. He was once connected with the Rebel army under the command of H Marshall; but roams over the County sometimes dressed as a federal soldier & sometimes in janes. More recently he has gone without his false whiskers --
Sect 22 page 374 1st vol Rev Stat authorizes the gov to issue the proclamation offering a reward for the apprehension of criminals.
P S. Advise me at once so that we may have hand bills struck

Harrison Co
$200 for Jas. O Kellar
